entry.title: Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 4 - Oolong the Terrible
entry.content:
Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 4 - Oolong the Terrible20150825
This is such a silly episode. I like that it ends up being a
goofy pig. It is also cute that Goku doesn't actually hurt people
if he doesn't have to, but just chases Oolong.
  • TV Shows
  • Dragon Ball

entry.title: Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 5 - Yamcha the Desert Bandit
entry.content:
Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 5 - Yamcha the Desert Bandit20150825
It's very strange that Oolong is suddenly in the group. He
provides another comic relief character that is silly in a
different way from Bulma and Goku. Yamcha is interesting because
he's the first one that can actually hurt Goku and where Goku
needs to fight a bit.
  • TV Shows
  • Dragon Ball

entry.title: Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 6 - Keep an Eye on the Dragon Balls
entry.content:
Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 6 - Keep an Eye on the Dragon Balls20150825
Yamcha's reaction to the Bulma is crazy and the fan-service of
Bulma dressing like a bunny girl is really ridiculous. At this
point I noticed that Oolong looks like Mao and is kind of
pathetic.
  • TV Shows
  • Dragon Ball

entry.title: Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 7 - The Ox King on Fire Mountain
entry.content:
Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 7 - The Ox King on Fire Mountain20150825
It's so funny again that Goku is super kind to the Ox King and
this causes him to actually realize that they should be
friends. It's also funny that Roshi is coming back into the story
and that there was always a connection between Goku and Roshi but
it didn't come up before. I wonder if Goku is actually vulnerable
in his tail, or if he just doesn't like it being touched.

Watching Dragon Ball each morning makes me feel like I'm in
elementary school again. When I was young, I would watch it each
morning while eating breakfast before going out to the bus.
  • TV Shows
  • Dragon Ball

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (3)20150824
I played for a while and beat Father Gascione. I cheesed him by
getting him stuck on the stairs. I did a little bit of grinding
after that so I could afford the key and the Kirkhammer. The
Kirkhammer feels like a bad purchase because it isn't as strong as
what I have already, but I suppose it will be stronger if I
upgrade it as much as the axe I already have. I explored the next
area a little bit, but not enough to get anywhere really.

Total time: 7:21

entry.title: Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 3 - The Nimbus Cloud of Roshi
entry.content:
Dragon Ball - Season 1 - Episode 3 - The Nimbus Cloud of Roshi20150824
The silliness of how Bulma gets the Dragon Ball is funny, as is

is movie. Three episodes for one ball!?

entry.title: Movie: Uranium - Twisting the Dragon's Tail, starring Derek Muller (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Uranium - Twisting the Dragon's Tail, starring Derek Muller (2015)20150823
We watched this today. It was very neat to learn some tidbits about
uranium and its uses that I hadn't known before. It was very
interesting when he was exploring the radioactive places. The new
kind of nuclear reactor they talked about was awesome. I think it's
lame he thinks we aren't ready for actual clean energy.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015) (2)20150821
I played today for about an hour. I got to the graveyard boss
fight and tried it out. I used the music box too much and didn't
beat it. So, I decided to go attack the Cleric Beast again. I did
it on the third try, I think. It was pretty epic when I finally
did it, because I had his pattern down really well and didn't even
use half my Blood Vials. It was cool!

Total time: 5:39
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015)
entry.content:
Game: Bloodborne (PS4, 2015)20150820
I played today for quite a while. I went with a Military Veteran
with the Pistol and the Axe.

It took me a long time to get used to the combat. The first area
of the street is really brutal with all the different enemies
wandering around. I walked slowly and was grabbed by the Wolves. I
went back (by sprinting) and got my Blood Echoes, then ran back
and went through the Kennels until I unlocked the shortcut. (I
love, by the way, that enemies take your Blood Echoes if they are
hunters. At first I didn't get it and was annoyed, but then I
realized it was great.) 

I tried to fight the Cleric Beast a few times, but failed and gave
up. I lost 6k souls from that, which hurt, but it was annoying
because I couldn't do anything with them anyways, since the fight
is what got me access to upgrading my level.

The game is pretty great. I was so nervous walking around with a
ton of Blood Echoes and not knowing the area. My wife came by and
I said, "My heart is pounding! This game is terrifying!"

Total time: 3:55
  • Video Games
  • Bloodborne
  • PS4
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (13)
entry.content:
Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (13)20150819
I played for a long time today as a day off. I finished the
campaign and decided to put the game down. I did not get 100%
though. Here are the things that I had left to do:

- 2 Shangri-La missions: I probably would have done them had they
been available during the first part of the game, but I felt I
had been playing too long when I got to the North and I didn't
really love the unique combat there. It was often very
"frontal", as opposed to my preferred way of steal thing when
fighting in the normal game.

- 2 Longinus missions: I never really liked the Himalayas
missions, for the same reason as the Shangri-La, but the blood
diamond ones were fun.

- 1 skill: I never did the Arena, so I never unlocked its skill
and upgraded it, although by the time I ended the game, I had 10
Skill points waiting to be assigned. I basically never used the
Syringes anyways.

- 5 weapons: There were 5 weapons that I never got, some related
to the things mentioned above. Since I didn't really have any
more missions to do, I wasn't stress about getting them just for
the sake of having them.

- Lots of quests: Given that I did one of each, and they were all
the same but in a different area, I wasn't crazy about doing
them all. I can see if I were younger and had more time than
games, I would definitely do them all.

- Lots of collectibles: I wasn't going to go and tear down every
poster, but I tore down all the ones I went near during the
normal course of things. I think I would have gotten more
collectibles had I flown in the Buzzer less.

I ended up with 67.15% completion and there were no interesting
trophies that were not collected. I sided with Amita the whole
time during the missions, although I felt near the end they were
both pretty dumb. I didn't kill anyone (Sabal or Pagan) and just
let them go. I think the character I played would have killed
Amita and taken over the country. I think the best thing for the
world of the game would have been to do the secret ending where
you just wait for Pagan to come back in the beginning.

I really enjoyed taking over the Outposts and Fortresses. That was
easily the funnest part of the game, because you had to scope them
out and decide how you were going to do it and it was pretty
free. The Propaganda Centers were similarly fun. I really enjoyed
the feeling of shooting a helicopter out of the sky and sniping
from an extreme distance without being detected.

Overall I was very satisfied with the game, but I can't imagine
playing another game like it any time soon, because I already feel
a bit burned out on what kind of activity it had me do.

Total time: 44:17
  • Video Games
  • Far Cry 4
  • PS4
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (12)
entry.content:
Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (12)20150818
I played for a little while and did a few campaign missions, but
ended the day in the middle of one. I was kind of hoping to finish
the game soon and start something else. I'm definitely enjoying
the moment to moment of it, but a part of me feels like the game
is too much of the same thing for too long. Of course, I'm mostly
doing that to myself by wanting to complete everything. It's
almost like eating cake for too long. It's hard to blame the cake
for being so yummy.

Total time: 34:25
  • Video Games
  • Far Cry 4
  • PS4
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (11)
entry.content:
Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (11)20150817
I did a bunch of campaign missions and some other missions as they
popped up. On most of the campaign missions, I tried to take a
stealth approach, but then switched to a frontal assault when I
couldn't. When I did the "City of Pain" mission, on the way out, I
used the grenade launcher a lot in my escape, which was pretty
silly. I did the heroin lab one, which was really cleverly done. I
bought all the weapons that I had unlocked because I had such a
huge surplus of money and very little to spend it on.

Total time: 33:39
  • Video Games
  • Far Cry 4
  • PS4
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (9)20150815
I did the first Hurk mission in the Himalayas, which was pretty
cool. I liked the moment of getting out of the water and doing a
takedown on the guy at the edge. Escaping the temple was pretty
fun too.

I did a bomb defusing quest, mainly to unlock another skill.

Then, I hunted some Sambar so I could craft another thing.

Next, I intend to do a Longinus quest so I can unlock the
reloading skill, then I'll get back on the campaign trail.

Total time: 27:39

  • Far Cry 4
  • PS4

entry.title: Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Far Cry 4 (PS4, 2014) (8)20150814
I did a lot in a short period of time today. First, I did some
hunting of leopards to get their skin to finance getting the
garden built at the Homestead. Then, I gathered plants to sell and
made a lot of money so that I could buy the Predator sniper rifle
and finish the Homestead. I was annoyed that nothing seemed to
really happy when I did and the Shrine wasn't even cool, it's just
a dopey source of a little money.

After that, I flew the Buzzer around and destroyed all the Pagan's
Wrath convoys from the air with grenades. I didn't realize that
they wouldn't just go away before, so I wanted them to be clear
while I explore the area. As I did that, I stopped at lots of
Unknown Locations to pick up their stuff and explore.

Once I did that, I did two Campaign missions to defend the
Monastery and then go to the Himalayas. When I was in the
Himalayas, I gathered all the Snow Leopard skins I need. Now, I
just need to get some Sambar skins and then I'm all set until I
unlock more Fashion Week events in the North. I think that I will
basically just be working on Campaign missions for a while.

Total time: 26:16
  • Video Games
  • Far Cry 4
  • PS4
  • 2014
